text:
Colony is a city in Anderson County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 408 people lived there.
History.
Colony was created in 1872. This was when a railroad was built through the area. It was named after a colony from Ohio and Indiana, which settled in the neighborhood.
The railroad tracks in Colony have since been changed to a rail trail. The trail is part of the Prairie Spirit Trail State Park.
Geography.
Colony is at (38.070803, -95.366109). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Weather.
Colony has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Colony has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 408 people, 177 households, and 112 families living in Colony.
